org.jerkar.api.depmanagement

Class JkVersionRange

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jerkar.api.depmanagement.JkVersionRange
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public final class JkVersionRange
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Expresses a version constraints for a given external modules. It can be an exact version as 1.4.2 or a dynamic version as [1.0,2.0[. As this tool relies on Ivy to to perform dependency resolution, you can use any syntax accepted by Ivy.
    See Also:
    ivy doc, Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static JkVersionRange UNSPECIFIED
      Mention that the version is unspecified

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String definition()
      Returns the range definition as string.
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj) 
      int hashCode() 
      boolean isDynamic()
      Returns true if the definition stands for a dynamic version (as "1.4.+", "[1.0,2.0[", "3.0-SNAPSHOT", ...) or false if it stands for a fixed one (as "1.4.0, "2.0.3-23654114", ...).
      boolean isDynamicAndResovable()
      Returns true if the definition stands for dynamic resolvable version (as 1.4.+, [1.0, 2.0[, ...).
      .
      boolean isUnspecified()
      Returns true if this version range is unspecified.
      static JkVersionRange of(java.lang.String definition)
      Creates a version range from String expression described at : http://ant.apache.org/ivy/history/latest-milestone/ivyfile/dependency.
      java.lang.String toString()

    • Method Detail

      • of

        public static JkVersionRange of(java.lang.String definition)
        Creates a version range from String expression described at : http://ant.apache.org/ivy/history/latest-milestone/ivyfile/dependency. html.

      • definition

        public java.lang.String definition()
        Returns the range definition as string. For example "1.4.2" or "3.2.+".

      • isDynamic

        public boolean isDynamic()
        Returns true if the definition stands for a dynamic version (as "1.4.+", "[1.0,2.0[", "3.0-SNAPSHOT", ...) or false if it stands for a fixed one (as "1.4.0, "2.0.3-23654114", ...).

      • isUnspecified

        public boolean isUnspecified()
        Returns true if this version range is unspecified.

      • isDynamicAndResovable

        public boolean isDynamicAndResovable()
        Returns true if the definition stands for dynamic resolvable version (as 1.4.+, [1.0, 2.0[, ...).
        . Returns false if the version is static or snapshot (as 1.4.0, 3.1-SNAPSHOT) A snapshot is not considered as 'resolvable'.
